title: Low Priority queue from a bug.
body:
I usually play league most days after I finish uni and never have any problems. but for the past two days I go to get into a game I pick my champion, I then get into the loading screen, but no I don't, I get kicked out and it says there is a firewall blocking my connection when I don't even have firewall turned on currently.

I'd appreciate feedback and I do not believe it's fair I have been placed into the low priority queue

replies.body:
>Windows 8
>DrBeatMyMeat
>PANIC! PANIC!!

I'm voting this for one of the best screenshots this year.

Anyway, what ISP are you with? Have you tried [using an alternative DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664#wq5) yet?
i live at my university therefore i'm using their government internet. i don't know how to muck about with the net here

Well, fortunately this does not actually muck around with their 'net'. All it does is command your computer to get its domain names from somewhere else.

Firstly, though, it's entirely possible that the 'government' internet is purposefully blocking communication to Riot's servers to some degree, thus being disconnected is inevitable.

Try changing the DNS (you only need to be an admin on your computer (and be the only one who uses it)) and see if it works.
riot still too lazy to care
